dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIT HIM, PERCY! GODDAMN IT, HIT HIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'MON, PERCY, HIT ME! HIT ME, YOU LIMP NOODLE, HIT ME! YEEHAWWW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and suddenly a hand comes in, grabs the hickory stick of Percy's grasp, raises it high-- --it's Brutal coming through the door. He swings the bato and lands an awesome blow to Billy's head--THUMP! The for of it spins Billy off his feet and slams him flat on his Dean crawls away, gulping ragged breaths of air. Amazingl Billy's still conscious--he looks up at Brutal and laughs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big fucker. Snuck up on me. No fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still laughing, he makes another grab at Dean. Brutal wha him again, turning his lights out for good. Brutal drops Dean's side, helping him hack air back into his lungs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe...breathe...that's it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's reining in their adrenaline. Paul glares at H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought he was doped. (to Percy) Didn't we? Didn't we all of us think he was doped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy nods, still numb. Paul is furious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't ask? I guess that's not a mistake you'll be need to make again anytime soon, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry shakes his head miserably. Paul grabs Billy by the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab his arms! You too, Percy! (off Percy's hesitation) Percy, goddamn it, get your feet out of cement and help us out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy finally unfreezes. The three of them hoist Billy up a dead-lift, get him in his cell, toss him on the cot. Th step out, slam the door, lock it. Paul looks to Harry and Brutal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Dean looked at right away, make sure he's all right. Percy, you go make a report to the warden for me. Start off by saying the situation is under control-- it's not a story, he won't appreciate you drawing out the suspense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? You look about ready to collapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the Mile till you all get back. Go on now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all exit. As soon as he's alone, Paul gives in to th pain, holding his crotch and sinking to his knees with a moan. It's so bad he actually lays down on the Mile, face pressed against the cool linoleum, wishing he were dead. stretch of silence...and then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss? Needs ta see ya down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a good time, John Coffey. Not a good time at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I needs ta see ya, boss. I needs ta talk t'ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sighs. Things couldn't get much worse than this. He rises with a supreme effort, walks painfully down the Mil

dialogues.speaker: COFFEY'S CELL
dialogues.text: ...and finds Coffey waiting at his bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alone here right now, John. Figure this is close enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, please. I got to whisper in your ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul blinks. Maybe it's the fever clouding his brain, or maybe...hell, is this what being hypnotized is like? He t to shake the sensation off, comes a little closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss? You know you not s'pose to do dat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind your business, Del. What do you want, John Coffey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand shoots out, grabs Paul by the collar, jerks him close. Paul makes a panic-grab for his revolver... ...but Coffey lays his free hand atop Paul's, eases his g from the gun--no need for that. Coffey's hand then drifts slowly down, easing to Paul's crotch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned, frozen) What are you...doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and something goes WHUMP through Paul's body. He arche back with his mouth agape and arms outstretched as a rush energy seems to pass from Paul through Coffey's hand... ...and then it's over. Paul comes back to the real world, weak against the bars, realizes Del is hollering in his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELP! JOHN COFFEY'S KILLING BOSS EDGECOMB! HELP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del, Chrissake, settle down, I'm fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It dawns on him that he really is fine. Fever's gone. So the pain in his groin. John Coffey, though, seems to be having trouble. He sits down on his bunk, bends forward, gagging like a man with a chicken bone caught in his thro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John? John, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul fumbles his keys to the lock, unsure if he should op the door, watching the big man's contortions grow stronge like a cat trying to cough up a hairball... ...and then comes an unpleasant, gagging/retching sound a Coffey's lips draw back from his teeth in a kind of godaw sneer...and he exhales a cloud of what look like tiny bla insects. They swirl furiously in front of his face, turn white...and disappear. Paul just stares, stunned. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do, big boy? What did you do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I helped it. Didn't I help it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but...how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey shrugs--it's something that just is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just took it back, is all. Awful tired now, boss. Dog tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls onto his bunk, faces the wall. Paul just stares him, stunned. He turns and walks up the Mile, his stiffne and pain now gone. Del watches him go by, also stunned:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What dat man do to you? He throw some gris-gris on you? (off Paul's look) You look diff'int! Even walk diff'int. Like y'all better!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're imagining thing. Lie down, Del. Get you some rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul continues up the Mile...

dialogues.speaker: E BLOCK TOILET
dialogues.text: ...and steps back into the toilet. Not trusting this situation for even a moment, Paul opens his fly, takes a breath to prepare himself for the pain, starts to pee... ...and we hear a healthy stream of water hitting the bowl The look on Paul's face says it all--blessed relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul comes home from work, still looking numb about the w thing. He drifts to the kitchen door. Jan's at the counte slicing vegetables for dinner. She glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, honey. How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...not too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back. Paul's eyes drift down to admire her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did the doctor say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. He's too busy staring. She turns again--he glances hastily up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know doctors. Gobble-de- gook mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back, keeps working. He crosses the room, eyein her ass all the way...and surprised her by pressing up against her from behind, running his hands along her hips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts laying kisses on the back of her neck, giving h pleasant shivers, murmuring:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it feel like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it feels like...it feels great...but...Paul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's getting her breathless. She turns into his arms and get into some passionate kissing. It's not too long befor they're frantically peeling each other's clothes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we find them having a wild tumble in the sheets, b moaning and groaning, sweating and panting. She pushes hi flat on the bed, pauses to catch her breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those must've been some pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and they keep going, rutting like crazed weasels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as their moans go drifting into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and they're still moaning up there as the sun creeps u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jan falls back, exhausted after the latest go-round. She catches her breath, looks over at Paul, and finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul? Not that I'm complaining. But we haven't gone four times in one night since we were nineteen. (off his look) You wanna tell me just what the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...thing is...I never actually got to the doctor yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a look--oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is on the phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal? Listen...I'm thinking of taking the morning off sick. You cover the fort for me? (beat) That's swell. Thanks. Yeah, I'm sure I'll feel better. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, turns to Jan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you ought to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what I'm sure of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's model T comes putt-putting up the road past a sign "Trapingus County Welcomes You."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURT HAMMERSMITH, public defender for Trapingus County, s with a cold soda and a magazine, watching his TWO CHILDRE playing on a swing at the far end of the backyard. The sc door opens and CYNTHIA HAMMERSMITH ushers Paul out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I offer you a cold drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am, a cold drink would be fine. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes back inside. Burt rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hammersmith. Your office said I'd find you at home today. I hope I'm not troubling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends, Mr.--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Edgecomb. I'm the E Block superintendant at Cold Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Green Mile. I've heard of it. Lost a few clients your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here. I'd like to ask you about one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt settles back down, motions "please sit".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which client? Now you got my curiosity aroused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Coffey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Coffey. He causing you problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, can't say he is. He doesn't like the dark. He cries on occasion. Other than that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cries, does he? Well, he's got a lot to cry about, I'd say. You know what he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I read the court transcripts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia reappears, hands Paul a cold root beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Missus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure. Kids! Lunch is about ready! Y'all come on up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes back inside, but the kids aren't quite able to t themselves away from their play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly are you trying to find out? Satisfy my curiosity, I'll see if I can satisfy yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've wondered if he ever did anything like that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Has he said anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But a man who does a thing like that has often developed a taste for it over time. Occurred to me it might be easy enough to follow his backtrail and find out. A man his size, and colored to boot, can't be that hard to trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think so, but you'd be wrong. Believe me, we tried. It's like he dropped out of the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you explain that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a Depression. A third of the country's out of work. People are drifting by the thousands, looking for work, looking for that greener grass. Even a giant like Coffey wouldn't get noticed everywhere he goes... not until he kills a couple of little girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's...strange, I admit. But there doesn't seem to be any real violence in him. I know violent men, Mr. Hammersmith. I deal with 'em day in and day out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt smiles, realizing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't come up here to ask me whether he might have killed before. You came up here to see if I think he did it at all. That's it, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One seldom sees a less ambiguous case. He was found with the victims in his arms. Blurted out a confession right then and there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet you defended him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is entitled to a defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia hollers from an open window:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids! Lunch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all listen to your Momma, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids start this way. Burt turns back to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you something. You listen close, too, because it might be something you need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had us a dog. No particular breed, but gentle. Ready to lick your hand or fetch a stick. Just a sweet mongrel, you know the kind. (Paul nods) In many way, a good mongrel dog is like you negro. You get to know it, and often you get to love it. It is of no particular use, but you keep it around because you think it loves you. If you're lucky, Mr. Edgecomb, you never have to find out any different. My wife and I were not so lucky. Caleb. Come here for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little boy comes to him, staring at his feet. Burt ti to raise the boy's chin. The boy resists for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then his face comes around. He's horribly scarred that side, the eye missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has the one eye. I suppose he's lucky not to be blind. We get down on our knees and thank God for that much at least. Right Caleb? (the boy nods shyly) Okay, go on in now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy races inside after his sister. Paul follows Burt' gaze off toward the rear of the property, where an unoccu doghouse stands weathered and sad in the weeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That dog attacked my boy for no reason. Just got it into his mind one day. Same with John Coffey. He was sorry afterwards, of that I have no doubt...but those little girls stayed raped and murdered nonetheless. Maybe he's never done it before--my dog never bit before, but I didn't concern myself with that. I went out there with my rifle and grabbed his collar and blew his brains out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for your trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt acknowledges the condolence with a gracious nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm as enlightened as the next man, Mr. Edgecomb. I would not bring back slavery for all the tea in China. I believe we have to be humane and generous in our efforts to solve the race problem. But we have to remember that the negro will bite if he gets the chance, just like a mongrel dog will bite if it crosses its mind to do so. (beat) Is Coffey guilty? Yes, he is. Don't you doubt it, and don't you turn your back on him. You might get away with it once or even a hundred times...but in the end...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his hand, making biting motions with his finger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul says nothing. Burt gazes out again. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have to tear that old doghouse down one of these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul drives back to Cold Mountain, his heart conflicted..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he walks onto the Mile with a bundle wrapped in a towel. Brutal glances up from the desk, sniffing the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul continues down the Mile. Whatever he's carrying, the smell of it brings Del to his bars. Even Mr.Jingles comes skittering out of his cigar box, sniffing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul arrives at Coffey's cell. Coffey's on his bunk facin the wall. His head comes around, drawn by the aroma. He s up, wipes the tears leaking from his eyes, looks at Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm smelling me some cornbread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul speaks softly so the others can't hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from my missus. She wanted to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey nods thoughtfully, absorbing this notion. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank me for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. For helping me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helping you with what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul motions discreetly to his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh. (beat) Was your missus pleased?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hands him the bundle through the bars. Coffey takes uncovers the cornbread reverently, gazes back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This all for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul nods. Across the way, Del is pressing his face longi through the bars while Mr. Jingles crawls on his shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my. John, I can smell it from here. I surely can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks to Paul) Can I give some to Del?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours, John. You do with it as you please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John carefully scoops a big chunk of cornbread out with h enormous hand, holds it through the bars to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's for Del and Mr. Jingles then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What about me? I'm'a get some too, ain't I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey looks to Paul--do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours, John. As you please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Fine. I think I'll keep the rest, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles like a big kid, digging in with his fingers. Pa crosses the Mile to Del's cell, hands him his share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Courtesy of the gentleman across the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, John. So very fine of you. So very kind. Mr. Jingles t'ank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) ...wel'cm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What about me? Don't you hold out on me, ya big dummy nigger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's temper flares--he steps to Billy's cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll keep a civil tongue on my block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Billy spits in Paul's face and follows it up with a grin--what are you gonna do about that? Paul is seething he wipes the spit off, but keeps his temper where it belo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get that one for free. But that's the last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks away. Billy laughs, hollering after him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? Just that little bitty one? Guess I'll have to pay out for the rest, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is walking the Mile, doing a cell check and jotting a clipboard. He pauses, making a notation... ...and a long stream of piss hits his leg. Billy's at his bars, peeing on him. Harry jumps back, stunned. Billy how with laughter, hosing his aim wildly from side to side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeehaaw! Good shot, weren't it? Oh, the look on your face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Brutal come running. Harry's just flabbergasted:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe this? Son of a bitch pissed on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, d'jall like that? I'm currently cooking some turds t'go with it! Nice soft ones! I'll have 'em out t'yall tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul stays calm, turns to Brutal, nods at the restraint r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been looking to clear that room out anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STREAM OF GUARDS comes toting the last of the restraint room stuff past Billy's cell while he heckles them from t bars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Whassit now, movin' day? Y'all wanna come in and dust a little? Y'can shine my knob for me while yer at it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he pauses as Paul and Brutal step to the bars. Pau has a canvas straitjacket. Brutal pulls his nightstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come in here on your legs, but you'll go out on your backs, Billy the Kid guarantee ya that. (motions to Brutal) C'mon, fuckstick. No sneakin' up on me this time. We'll go man to man, see who's the better fel--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal unlocks the cell--and sidesteps, revealing Harry pointing a fire hose. The hose erupts, driving Billy acro the cell with bone-jarring force. They batter him half- senseless, then cut the water. Billy collapses in a heap. Paul and Brutal drag him semi-conscious from his cell and the straitjacket on him. He comes around as they draw the straps tight and pull him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Wild Bill. Little walky walky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you call me that! Wild Bill Hickock wasn't no range rider! He was just a bushwackin' John Law! Dumb sonovabitch sat with his back to the door and kilt by a drunk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my suds and body! A history lesson! You just never know what you're gonna get when you come to work everyday on the Green Mile. Thank you, Wild Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy lets out a scream of rage and throws himself at Bru Brutal, bored, shoves him back toward Paul, who then prop him down the Mile toward the open restraint room door. Bi sees where they intend to put him, resorts to pleading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, not in there! C'mon now, I'll be good! Honest Injun I will! No! No! Ummmmhhhh...urg...ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly drops to the floor, bucking and jerking wildl spewing drool. Harry's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Christ, he's pitchin' a fit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul reaches down and unceremoniously starts dragging Bil kicking and writhing the rest of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be fine, boys. Trust me on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal helps Paul toss Billy headlong into the padded roo They slam the door...

dialogues.speaker: RESTRAINT ROOM
dialogues.text: ...and Billy staggers to his feet in the straitjacket, inarticulate with rage, starts throwing himself against t door, screaming at the top of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL I WANTED ME WAS A LITTLE CORNBREAD, YOU MUTHERFUCKERS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Brutal unlock the restraint room. Billy looks up from the corner, pale and drained. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learnt my lesson. I'll be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's back in his cell, quiet for a change. Toot-Toot i outside the bars, mopping the floor. Billy notices a chocolate Moon Pie in Toot's shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pssss. Hey. Give'ya nickel for that Moon Pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toot looks around. Nobody's watching, and a nickel's a nickel. He steps to Billy's bars, swaps the Moon Pie for money. Toot hurries away. Billy unwraps the Moon Pie, makes sure he's not being watched...and crams the entire thing into mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and here comes Brutal strolling down the Mile, doing a cell check and jotting on a clipboard. He pauses, seeing: Billy at his bars. Just standing there staring. His cheek bulging way out. Brutal steps closer, fascinated...what the fuck is that. Billy waits until he's just a bit closer-- --and he slams his fists against his own cheeks, propelli a disgusting spew of liquefied chocolate sludge into Brut face. Billy falls back onto his bunk, shrieking with laug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Li'l Black Sambo, yassuh, boss, yassuh, howdoo you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, calmly) Hope your bags are packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and once again, Billy gets dragged to the restraint ro kicking and screaming all the way. They toss him in, slam door. Brutal turns, still wiping traces of sludge off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moon Pie thing was pretty original. Gotta give him that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal nods. They walk away as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Brutal appear at Del's bars with Harry and Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del, grab your things. Big day for you and Mr. Jingles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatchoo talkin' bout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Important folks heard about your mouse, wanna see him perform. Not just guards, either. One of them's a politician all the way from the state capital, I believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del swells with pride upon hearing this. He scrounges up Jingles props, steps from his cell, looks to Harry and De

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fellas comin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got other fish to fry just now, Del, but you knock 'em for a loop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del nods, beaming happily, looks to Coffey in his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knock 'em for a loop like Mr. Harry says, Del.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal leads Del up the Mile, Paul and the others at thei heels. Percy's at the duty desk. He smirks and rolls his as Del goes by. The moment Brutal and Del are out the doo ...Toot emerges from Paul's office where he's been hiding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move along briskly, folks. There's not much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toot hurries down to take his place in Del's cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sittin' down, I'm sittin' down, I'm sittin' down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HALF DOZEN GUARDS are waiting. We find Bill Dodge fixin the tie of a fat good ol' boy named EARL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been sweepin' floors here ten years, never had to wear no damn tie before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a V.I.P. today, Earl, so just shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK at the door. Everybody takes a seat. Del is usher in by Brutal. Del faces his audience, puts his hands to h chest in a "thank you" gesture worthy of Lillie Langtry before her adoring public, then announces grandly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Messieurs et mesdames! Bienvenue au cirque de mousie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steel cap is lowered over Toot's head, the straps tightened. TILT UP to Percy as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll on two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind his partition, Van Hay mimes flipping the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. Percy looks anxiously to Paul, who's trading gla with the other guards. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. Very professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy smiles. Harry and Dean step up, slapping his back a shaking his hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and they're still chatting a short time later, waiting Del's return. Percy actually looks happy for a change, feeling genuinely accepted for the first time... Billy is watching from his cell. Just watching. The door opens. Del returns with Mr. Jingles on his shoul escorted by Brutal. Brutal is toting the cigar box and sp like a magician's assistant carrying the boss' props.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They love Mr. Jingles! They laugh and cheer and clap they hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's just aces. Pop back in your cell, old-timer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The generosity of Percy's tone catches Del completely off guard. Del gives him a look of almost comical mistrust... ...and the old Percy comes back. He bares his teeth in a snarl and curls his fingers as if to grab Del. It's a jok but Del doesn't know that--he jerks back in fear and trip over Brutal's big feet. Del goes down hard, hitting the linoleum with the back of his head. Mr. Jingles jumps cle goes squeaking down the Mile. Del sits up, painfully clutching his head. Brutal helps him up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy, you shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and moves him toward his cell. Percy is actually moved apologize--he starts after them with a half-laugh, drifti much too close to Wild Bill's side of the Mile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del! Hey, you numb wit, I didn't mean nothin' by it! You all ri--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Wild Bill's arms thrust out, grabbing Percy and slamming him back against the bars with an arm around his throat. Percy squeals like a pig in a slaughter-chute, thinking he's gonna die. The guards scramble, drawing the clubs--as Billy strokes Percy's hair and whispers in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't you sweet. Soft. Like a girl. I druther fuck your asshole than your sister's pussy, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy kisses Percy's ear--and his hand drops down to sque Percy's crotch. Paul pulls his sidearm, taking aim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wharton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Billy lets go, stepping back with his hands raised laughing. Percy darts across the Mile in terror and cring against the cell opposite, breathing so loud and fast it almost sounds like sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I let 'im go, I'us just playin' and I let 'im go! Never hurt a hair on his purty head! (grins at Percy) Your noodle ain't limp at all, loverboy! I think you sweet on ol' Billy the Kid... (sniffs his fingers) ...oooh, but smell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down at his cell, Del starts laughing shrilly. Everybody starts to realize it, including Percy himself...he looks down, sees the huge dark stain spreading at his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookit, he done piss his pants! Look what the big man done! He bus' other people wid 'is stick, mais oui some mauvais homme, but someone touch him, he make water in his pants jus' like a baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy just stares. Brutal shoves Delacroix into his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Del.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul steps to Percy, puts a hand on his shoulder. Percy shakes his hand off, looks around at their faces, whisper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk about this to anyone, I'll get you all fired. I swear that to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens on the Mile, stays on the Mile. Always has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men nod solemnly. Nobody's going to talk about this. Percy looks at Delacroix still snorting in his cell, poin at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep laughing, you French- fried faggot. You just keep laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del falls silent. Percy turns and storms away as we

dialogues.speaker: IN BLACKNESS, A TITLE CARD APPEARS
dialogues.text: "The Bad Death of Eduard Delacroix"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is sitting with Delacroix. Brutal is leaning against bars. Del is throwing the spool. Mr. Jingles is fetching The silence is thick. Just the clack-clatter of the spool and the skitter skitter of tiny mouse paws on concrete. I getting on Paul's nerves in a big way. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Dean? He's got a little boy would love a pet mouse, I bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del looks horrified at the thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could a boy be trust wid Mr. Jingles? Maybe forget to feed him. And how he keep up wid his trainin', just a boy, n'est-ce pas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del tosses the spool again--clack-clatter, skitter-skitte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T'ank you kindly, merci beaucoup, but you live out in the woods, and Mr. Jingles, he be scared to live out dans la foret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whisper that in your ear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del nods, tosses the spool again--clack-clatter, skitter skitter. Paul is completely out of ideas. But then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Mouseville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouseville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tourist attraction down in Florida. Tallahassee, I think. Is that right, Paul? Tallahassee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (level) Yeah, that's right. Tallahassee. Just down the road apiece from the dog university.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal's mouth twitches, but he manages to keep a straigh face. He gives Paul a look--don't blow this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they'd take Mr. Jingles? You think he's got the stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might. He's pretty smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What dis Mouseville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tourist attraction, I said. They got this big tent you go into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a cirque? You have to pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shittin' me? Course you pay. Dime a piece, two cents for the kids. And inside the tent there's this mouse city made out of boxes and toilet paper rolls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy is drifting up the block, listening too, but nobody really paying him much mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...plus they got the Mouseville All-Star Circus. There's mice that swing on trapeze, mice that roll barrels, mice that stack coins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dat's it! Dat's da place for Mr. Jingles! You gonna be a circus mouse after all! Gonna live in a mouse city down in Florida!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del tosses the spool extra hard--it takes a bad bounce of the wall and goes clattering through the bars onto the Mi The mouse goes after it like a shot, too intent to notice His old enemy Percy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy stomps the heel of his heavy work shoe down on Mr. Jingles. There's a SOFT SNAP as the mouse's back breaks. Del screams in horror and throws himself at the bars, sob the mouse's name. Percy looks to Brutal and Paul, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knew I'd get him sooner or later. Just a matter of time, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and strolls up the Mile, leaving Mr. Jingles dyi in a tiny pool of blood. Up at the duty desk, Dean and Ha get up from a cribbage game, stunned and furious. Percy strolls past, exits to the execution chamber. Del i still screaming, all his pent-up terror and grief pouring at the dying mouse. And then comes a soft, urgent voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give'm to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn. Coffey's got his arms out through his bars, on massive hand spread open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give'm to me. Might still be time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hesitates, scoops the mouse up off the floor, wincin the feel of it. Splintered bones are poking at the hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul doesn't answer, just lays Mr. Jingles into Coffey's hand. Coffey pulls the mouse in through his bars and lays other hand gently over it, cupping the creature. All we s now is the tail hanging out the side, twitching weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, what the hell--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul motions him quiet. Del is pleading softly at his bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, John. Oh Johnny, help him, please help him, s'il vous plait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Dean join the group. Everybody watching now. Coffey puts his mouth to his cupped hands, inhales sharpl The world hangs suspended for a moment. Coffey raises his face, contorting as if desperately ill, starts making tho horrendous choking sounds in his throat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Oh, dear Jesus. The tail. Look at the tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do. The tail is no longer weak and dying. It's snapp briskly back and forth, as if ready to play. Coffey makes that retching/gagging sound...and again exha a cloud of swirling black "insects" from his nose and mou The men watch, speechless, as the bugs turn white and disappear. Coffey bends down, opens his hand. Mr. Jingles bounds off fingers through the bars, racing past the guards' feet. T turn to see Del gather the mouse up, laughing and crying. Dean turns back to Coffey with a stunned whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I helped Del's mouse. He a circus mouse. Goan live in a mouse city down in...down in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (numb) Florida?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey nods, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Percy's bad. He mean. He step on Del's mouse. (softly) I took it back, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, he lies back on his bunk and faces the wal The others look to Paul, don't even know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brute, come along with me. (to Harry and Dean) You fellas go on back to you cribbage game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry nods numbly. Paul leads Brutal up the Mile...

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: ...and they enter to find Percy polishing Old Sparky's ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start in on me. It was just a mouse. Never belonged here in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mouse is fine. Just fine. You're no better at mouse-killing than anything else around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect me to believe that? I heard the goddamn thing crunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul steps closer, angry as we've ever seen him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you glad Mr. Jingles is okay? After all our talks about how we should keep the prisoners calm? Aren't you relieved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of game is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No game. See for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Percy stalks past them, heads out onto the Mile. Pa and Brutal just wait, saying nothing. Brutal picks up the left by Percy, resumes polishing chores on Old Sparky. Pa stretches, cracks his neck. The silence heavy... ...until Percy reappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You switched them! You switched them somehow, you bastards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always keep a spare mouse in my wallet for occasions such as this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're playing with me, the both of you! Just who the hell do you think you are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal grabs him , slams him bodily into the electric cha Paul bends close, gets right in Percy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the people you work with, Percy, but not for long. I want your word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put you out front for Del, you put in your transfer to Briar Ridge the very next day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I just call up certain people and tell them you're harassing me? Bullying me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. I promise you'll leave your share of blood on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over a mouse? You think anyone's gonna give two shits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But four men will swear you stood by while Wild Bill tried to strangle Dean to death. About that people will care, Percy. Even your uncle the governor will care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing like that goes in your work record. Work record can follow a man around a long, long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy looks from one man to another, knowing he's trapped

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put you out front, you put in your transfer. That's the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy thinks it over, nods. He tries to get up, but Paul him pinned...and pointedly offer his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make a promise to a man, you shake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy hesitates, shakes Paul's hand...

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: ...and Paul pulls him out of the electric chair as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witnesses are trickling in, filling the seats. A storm is brewing, sending FLASHES OF LIGHTNING across the floors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del sits with Mr. Jingles in his lap, stroking the mouse between the ears. Paul, Brutal, and Harry appear at the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, boys. Say hi, Mr. Jingles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eduard Delacroix, will you step forward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss Edgecomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Del?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don' let nothin' happen to Mr. Jingles, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul nods--I promise. Del rises, steps to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del lifts his hand. Mr. Jingles steps off onto Paul's shoulder with no hesitation. Gently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del. I can't have a mouse on my shoulder while...you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take him, boss. Jus' for now. If Del don' mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you take 'im, John. Take him til' dis foolishment done--bien! (to Paul and Brutal) After, you take him down to Florida? To dat Mouseville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do it together, most likely. Maybe take a little vacation time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul moves to Coffey's cell. The mouse skitters off Paul' shoulder onto Coffey's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People pay a dime apiece to see him. Two cents for the kiddies. Ain't dat right, Boss Howell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Del.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a good man, Boss Howell. You too, Boss Edgecomb. Wish I could'a met you bot' someplace else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del gives Mr. Jingles one last look, starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Au revoir, mon ami. Je t'aime, mon petit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they start to walk the Mile...

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Sweltering in the damp heat. Rain is pissing down, drummi the tin roof. People glance up uneasily as THUNDER BOOMS. FAT LADY is staring grimly at the electric chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope he's good and scared. Hope he knows the fires are stoked, and that Satan's imps are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: Del enters, horrified to see Percy waiting at Old Sparky. Paul gives Del's arm a reassuring squeeze, leads him forward...

dialogues.speaker: IN A TIGHT SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: The clamps are applied. The straps are drawn tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll on one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights brighten on a RISING HUM. Witnesses look up.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MILE
dialogues.text: Coffey looks up as the overheads flare hotter and hotter, whispers to the mouse in his hands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be still, Mr. Jingles. You be so quiet and so still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eduard Delacroix, you have been condemned to die by a jury of your peers, sentence imposed by a judge in good standing in this state. You have anything to say before sentence is carried out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del tries to speak. Doesn't quite manage the first time. Licks his lips and tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sorry for what I do. I give anything to take it back, but I can't. God have mercy on me. (whispers to Paul) Don' forget 'bout Mouseville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Brutal nod--and are stunned as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No such place. That's just a fairy tale these guys told you to keep you quiet. Just thought you should know, faggot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stricken look in Del's eyes tells us a part of him ha known all along. Paul and Brutal would both like to deck Percy right about now, and he knows it--he gives them a " are you gonna do about it" smile. Nothing they can do. Paul nods to Harry, who takes the bl mask from the back of the chair and rolls it down over De head, leaving the top of his shaved head exposed.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: takes the sponge and bends down to the bucket of brine. T other don't see it, but we do: Percy only pretends to dip the sponge and soak it. It nev touches the water. He straightens up and places the spong atop Delacroix's head, hiding it with his hands. The cap is lowered. Paul and the others haven't yet reali what's happened. THUNDER BOOMS and LIGHTNING CRASHES as P hides a smile, steps back to address the condemned:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electricity shall now be passed through your body until you are dead, in accordance with state law. God have mercy on your soul.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON PAUL
dialogues.text: as realization starts to dawn. He stares at the bucket, t across the floor to Delacroix, coming to terms with the evidence of his eyes--there's no water on the floor or dripping down the sides of Del's neck. Paul's eyes widen. A stunned beat of horror. He starts to open his mouth to scream "NO!", but Percy beats him to it with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll on two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Hay flicks the switch. WHAM. The electricity hits hom and Del rocks forward, riding the current. Then things start to go horribly wrong. The HUMMING loses its steadiness and starts to waver with CRACKLING SOUND. Tendrils of smoke begin curling from und the cap, a mixture of burning hair and sponge. Brutal sho Paul a horrified look. Paul responds with a harsh whisper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix begins twisting and jittering in the chair, his masked face snapping violently from side to side, his leg pistoning up and down in his restraints. There's a MUFFLED POP from under the cap, like a pine kno exploding in a hot fire. Smoke starts coming through the fabric of the mask, puffing upward. Del is being cooked alive. Paul spins to the partition, hollering--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but Brutal grabs his arm, whispers fiercely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you tell him to stop. Don't you do it. It's too late for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns back, helpless. The other guards are trading w looks, unable to believe what's happening. Even Percy loo aghast--he was expecting something, but not this. Del begins SCREAMING--the wild, hysterical sound of an an being shredded alive in a hay baler. The HUMMING goes une and ragged, the lights rising and falling...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MILE
dialogues.text: ...as Del's screams rise and fall with them, echoing up t corridor. Coffey's shaking and screaming too, as if feeli Del's pain. Mr. Jingles squirms out of his grasp and goes squeaking in terror toward the restraint room door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE'S COOKIN' NOW! THEY COOKIN' HIM GOOD! NEAR ABOUT DONE, I RECKON!

dialogues.speaker: RESUME EXECUTION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Wrong. Del's nowhere near about done. He's slamming back forth in the chair hard enough to shake the platform, twisting hard against the leather restraints. We hear BON BREAKING. A WOMAN'S SCREAMS. Witnesses start rising to th feet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's happening to him?...Are those clamps going to hold?...Christ, the smell!...Is this normal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mask bursts into flame on Delacroix's face. Van Hay hollers through the wire mesh, horrified:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOULD I KILL THE JUICE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! ROLL, FOR CHRIST'S SAKE, ROLL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry scoops up the bucket of water to throw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No water! No water! You crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry backs off with a look of dazed understanding--you d throw water on a man getting juiced. Right. He drops the bucket, races to get the chemical fire extinguisher inste The flaming mask peels away, revealing Del's charring fac His eyeballs are misshapen globs of burning white jelly b out of their sockets. The ATTENDING DOCTOR faints dead aw Pandemonium now in the room. People shouting and hurrying exit, chairs falling over, women screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, stop it, oh can't you see he's had enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal grabs Paul by the shoulder, spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you shut it down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still alive! You want me to shut down while he's still alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is horrified at the thought. Del is jittering and screaming, rocking from side to side, smoke pouring from nostrils and mouth, his tongue sizzling purple-black. The witnesses are crowding and shoving to get out, but th back door is locked. All they can do is cluster there. Paul sees Percy with his head turned away. He grabs him, forces his head around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch, you son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry steps up, the extinguisher in his hands. Waiting. D finally slumps over. He still vibrating, but now it's jus the effect of current flowing through his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Hay kills the current. The HUMMING DIES. Brutal grabs extinguisher from Harry, shoves it into Percy's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do it. You're running the show, ain't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy, sick and dazed, aims the extinguisher and hoses th smoking corpse. Hal is near the back, calming the crowd:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, folks, it's all under control. Just a power surge from the storm, that's all, nothing to worry about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean, get doc's stethoscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean drops to the doctor's bag, digs through it, hands up stethoscope. Paul plugs them into his ears. People are moaning and sobbing at the back of the room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Is it always like this? Why didn't somebody tell me? I never would have come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul wipes some foam away from Delacroix's chest, places stethoscope pad to the raw flesh. He nods to Brutal--it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and the others bring the stretcher down, lay the cor on the gurney. Percy starts stammering excuses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know the sponge was supposed to be wet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal hauls off and slugs him. A scuffle ensues as the others grab Brutal and pull him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, no? How can you say no? You saw what he did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix's dead, nothing can change that, and Percy's not worth it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he just gets away with it? Is that how it works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal comes lunging down the stairs, furious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that? Jesus Christ, three witnesses puked all over the floor up there! And the smell! I got Van Hay to open both doors, but that smell won't come out for five damn years, that's what I'm betting! And that asshole Wharton is singing about it! I can hear him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Can he carry a tune, Hal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This pulls the plug on the moment--Hal snorts, triggering laughter among the men, a wild release of tension and fea Everybody starts feeling a bit saner again as it dies dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, boys. Okay. Now what the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes go to Percy. Hal turns, sees Percy's bloody lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy? Something to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know the sponge was supposed to be wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. A look of utter contempt from Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many years you spend pissing on the toilet seat before somebody told you to put it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy fucked up, Hal. Pure and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your official position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think it should be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal considers it, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be putting in a transfer request to Briar Ridge tomorrow. Moving on to bigger and better things. Isn't that right, Percy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy nods. Hal steps close, gives him a tight, icy smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a little asshole, and I don't like you a bit. (off Percy's look) Have that transfer request on my desk first thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal heads back up the stairs. Brutal shoves Percy aside a wheels Delacroix's body down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul returns to find Wild Bill making up a song in his ce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Barbecue! Me and you! Stinky, pinky, phew-phew-phew! Weren't Billy or Jilly or Hilly or Roy--it was a French-fried faggot named Delacroix!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about ten seconds away from spending the rest of your life in the padded room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy falls silent. Paul continues down the Mile to Coffe cell. Coffey's on his bunk, face streaked with tears. He wipes his eyes with the heels of his hands like an exhaus child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Del. Poor old Del.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Poor old Del. John, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could feel it from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You could hear it? Is that what you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out of it now, though. He's the lucky one. No matter how it happened, Del's the lucky one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul realizes he won't get a coherent answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mr. Jingles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points vaguely) Ran down there. Don't think he'll be back. (beat) Awful tired now, boss. Dog tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey lays down, turns to face the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, John. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul enters in darkness, hangs his hat. He drifts into th kitchen, clicks on the radio. SOFT MUSIC BEGINS: Gene Aus singing "Did You Ever See A Dream Walking?" He pours a drink at the kitchen table, takes a sip, lays glass down. Jan sleepily appears from the darkness behind him, entering the kitchen. He realizes she's there, glanc back. She can sense the weight on his soul. She comes to him, f his head into her arms. They stand that way, he drawing strength and she giving it, as the music plays on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS the pews to find Paul and Jan seated togeth in the congregation, voices raised in hymn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's Model T comes sputtering up the road. He and Jan a taking a drive, still in their Sunday best...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Jan wait at the front door. Jan holds a baking d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Hal, looking tired, ushers them inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and they walk outside to find MELINDA MOORES sitting i the sun, frail and wasted, a blanket on her knees. She'd beautiful if not for the cancer killing her. Paul is shocked at her appearance, hides it as best as he can. Jan covers this for him--she drops to Melinda's side with a warm smile and a kiss, takes the woman's frail han in hers. Paul catches Jan's eye. The look he gives her says it all don't know what I'd do without you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we find Paul and Hal talking quietly over beers wh the women visit b.g.:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's having one of her good days. I thank God for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a bad day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Sometimes she's...not herself anymore. She swears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just pops out, the most awful language you can imagine. She doesn't even know she's doing it. I didn't know she'd ever heard words like that...and to hear her say them in her sweet voice... (gazes off) I'm glad she's having a good day, Paul. I'm glad for you and Jan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is wide awake, staring at the dark. Jan can sense hi brooding. She rolls over sleepily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? If you don't say what's on your mind, I'm afraid I'll have to smother you with a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking I love you. I'm thinking I don't know what I'd do if you were gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I'm also thinking I'd like to have the boys over tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Jan's look, we

dialogues.speaker: INT. DINING ROOM- DAY
dialogues.text: Brutal, Harry, and Dean are seated at the table with Paul Jan. Serving plates are being passes, everybody digging i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (various, ad-lib) Ma'am, you sure know how to fry up some fine chicken...Brutal, don't hog the taters now...Try that corn yet? It's something special...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul softly interjects:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw what he did with the mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops everybody cold. Dean puts his chicken down, wi his hands. Looks are traded in the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could'a gone the rest of the day without you bringing that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could'a gone the rest of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did it to me too. He put his hands on me and took my bladder infection away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men absorb this. Brutal glances to Jan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he came home, he was...all better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about an authentic healing. A praise-Jesus miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say it, I accept it. But what's it got to do with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jan looks to Paul, realization starting to dawn:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melinda? Oh, Paul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melinda? Melinda Moores?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul nods--that's who we're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think you can help her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a bladder infection, or even a busted-up mouse. But there might be a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on now. You're talking about our jobs. Sneak a sick woman onto a cellblock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal would never allow that. You know him, he wouldn't believe something unless it fell on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're talking about taking John Coffey to her. That's more than just our jobs, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right. That's prison time if we get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not discuss this like it's even an option. Brutal, help me out here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal lets out a deep breath, considering. He looks to P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she's a fine woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The finest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to her is an offense, Brutal. To the eyes and the ears and the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no doubt. But we don't know her like you and Jan do...do we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why it's a lot to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. Let's not forget Coffey's a murderer. What if he escapes? I'd hate losing my job or going to prison, but I'd hate having a dead child on my conscience even more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that'll happen... (beat, softly) ...in fact, I don't think he did it at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are stunned by this. Off their looks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't see God putting a gift like that in the hands of a man who would kill a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's a tender notion, but the man's on death row for the crime. Plus, he's huge. If he tried to get away, it'd take a lot of bullets to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd all have shotguns in addition to sidearms. I'd insist on that. (to Paul) He tried anything, we'd have to take him down. You understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) So. Tell us what you had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: IN BLACKNESS, A TITLE CARD APPEARS
dialogues.text: "Night Journey"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLASHLIGHT BEAM plays across a glass cabinet, scanning contents. The beam pauses. A hand enters frame, unlocks t cabinet, pulls out a bottle of morphine tablets... ...and WE ANGLE TO Brutal as he shakes half a dozen pills onto his palm, pockets them, replaces the bottle on the shelf. He turns and slips five bucks to a NIGHTSHIFT ORDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was never here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, for five bucks, you was never nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MORPHINE PILL is being crushed to powder on the stainle steel gurney. TILT UP to Paul crushing the pills. Brutal carefully scrapes the powder onto a small sheet of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy is parked in Paul's chair with his feet up, reading book titled: "CARING FOR MENTAL PATIENTS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Dean are playing cards at the duty desk, tensio thick, cards slapping softly as the seconds tick by. Paul Brutal finally show up toting bottles of RC cola:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas thirsty? Fresh out of the icebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks. That's swell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hot in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin popping the caps off, swigging cola. The sound it brings Billy to his bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey, I'm'a get some too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass you get some too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you deserve any?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks a clipboard) Day report says he's been okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, yes, I been behaved. C'mon, now, don't be stingy hogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul shrugs to Brutal--why not? Brutal pops the top off a bottle, passes it to Paul. Paul grabs a tin cup, sets it the desk...and we see it contains the morphine powder. He pours the cola, swirls it around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Coffey looks up, sensing something happening. He pe up the Mile as Paul walks to:

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S CELL
dialogues.text: Billy reaches for the cup, but Paul keeps it out of reach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna stay behaved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you clunk, gimme that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise me, or I'll drink it myself right here in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon now, don't be that way. I be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul lets him take the cup. Billy knocks it back, drainin in three huge swallows. He lets out an awesome belch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll break out the fire hose and take it anyway. And you will have drunk your last R.C. cola. Unless they serve 'em down in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's smile fades. He hands the cup through the bars. P takes it, turns and heads back to--

dialogues.speaker: THE DUTY DESK
dialogues.text: --where Brutal, Harry, and Dean have been watching the en exchange with their hearts in their throats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we find Billy staring glassy-eyed at the ceiling. keels over on his bunk. ANGLE to Paul and Brutal stepping the bars with Harry and Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody wants to back out, now's the time. After this, there's no turning back. (off their looks) So? We gonna do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice comes softly from down the way:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I'd like to take a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their heads come slowly around, staring at Coffey in shoc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paul) Guess were all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy looks up from his book as the door opens. Paul ente with Brutal and Harry, ominously hemming the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls the canvas straitjacket from behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy jumps up and tries to the execution chamber, but Ha grabs him, spins him back. A wild scuffle ensues as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me! Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settle down, Percy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy tries to jerk away, crashes into the desk. The book was reading falls to the floor-- --and a "Tijuana Bible" is revealed within the pages. It' pornographic cartoon book of the type popular in the '30' featuring crude drawings of famous cartoon characters or movie stars engaged in outlandish sexual acts. This one h Olive Oyl getting it doggy-style from Popeye. The word balloon over his head features his famous laugh: "Uk-uk-u uk!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooo, Poicy! What would your mother say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go, you ignoramus! I know people! Big people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've said. C'mon, stick out your arms like a good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't. And you can't make me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead wrong about that, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutal grabs Percy by the ears, twisting hard. Percy lets a shriek--not just of pain, but a dismayed understanding he's not going to bluster his way out of this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna put your arms up? I'll rip your ears off. Use 'em for tea caddies. You know I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's ripping your ears off, Percy. I'd do as he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy jerks his arms up before him. They get the straitja on him within seconds. Percy turns to Paul on the verge o tears. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Paul. Don't put me in with Wild Bill. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would think that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul gives him a hard, angry shove...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and they bring him down the Mile to the restraint room door. Brutal takes Percy's holster and baton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get 'em back, don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more than I can say about your jobs. All your jobs! You can't do this to me! You can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul steps forward with a roll of strapping tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let you in on a little secret. We can and we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps the tape over Percy's mouth and shoves him back the restraint room. Percy stands breathing heavily throug his nose, making muffled mmmmph-mmmph! sounds under the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have a few hours of quiet time now, so you can reflect on what you did to Del.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) If you get lonely, think about Olive Oyl... (thrusting his hips) ...uk-uk-uk-uk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they slam the door, shutting Percy into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: A WALL-MOUNTED GUN SAFE
dialogues.text: is unlocked, shotguns pulled out. The men load up, headin down the Mile as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more time--what do you say if somebody comes by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey got upset, so we put him in the restraint room. They hear any noise, they'll think it's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to Coffey's cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We goan for the ride now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cell is unlocked. Coffey emerges. Paul motions them along, still grilling Dean:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're over in Admin, going over Del's file. Brutal and Harry are in the laundry doing their wash--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A skinny white arm suddenly shoots out from Wild Bill's c and grabs Coffey by the wrist. The men gasp, shocked to s Billy on his feet, grinning and weaving like a punch-drun Coffey's reaction is beyond simple surprise; he's actuall trembling at Billy's touch as if some electrical circuit engaged. His eyes are wide and horrified, as if he'd just his hand in a basket full of snakes. He tries to pull awa but Billy has him tight, that mysterious circuit blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurring wildly) Where you fink you're goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey responds softly, with utmost horror:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bad man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'right, nigger. Bad as you'd want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul plucks Billy's hand off Coffey's arm--and Coffey flinches back as the circuit is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whooeee. Whole room's spinning. Like I'm shit-ass drunk. I have me some shine or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and staggers back to his bunk, muttering all the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niggers oughtta have they own 'lectric chair. White man oughtn't havta sit in no nigger 'lectric chair, nossir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes face-first onto his bunk. Coffey is still staring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a bad man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey is brought in...and freezes in horror at the sight Old Sparky. A whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still in there. Pieces of them, still in there. I hear them screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes go to the electric chair. It sits shrouded in sh like an ominous throne. Never before has this place felt haunted to the men. It makes the hairs on the neck stand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, come along! Right now, y'hear? C'mon! Toward that door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey finally responds, pulling away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and they come down the steps. They realize Coffey will have to stoop all the way down the tunnel. Paul pats the gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie down on this. (off Coffey's look) It'll be easier for you and no harder for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey eases carefully onto the gurney, lying on his back His knees hang over the edge and his toes touch the groun but it works. They push him along, traversing the pools o light. Coffey actually starts to smile. He reaches out his arms, fingertips touching the tunnel walls as they go by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say. This is fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive iron door SQUEALS open onto a little-used fence enclosure. Paul and the others bring Coffey up from the tunnel below, emerging into the night. Coffey's breath catches as he gazes wondrously up at the stars, pointing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, boss! It's Cassie, the lady in the rocking chair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. John, you have to be quiet now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) You see her? You see the lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see her, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry goes first, hugging the shadows as he pulls his key unlock the gate...

dialogues.speaker: PRISON
